% Appendix B: Detailed Results Tables

\chapter{Detailed Results Tables}
\label{app:detailed-results}

\section{Overview}

This appendix provides complete numerical results for all experimental conditions, including summary statistics and cross-condition comparisons.

\section{Condition 1: Baseline Features (47) + Unweighted}
% Results generated by experimental pipeline (see Chapter~\ref{ch:experimental-design})

\subsection{Dataset A: MDVR-KCL Summary}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\small
\begin{tabular}{@{}llccccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & \textbf{Model} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{Precision} & \textbf{Recall} & \textbf{F1} & \textbf{ROC-AUC} \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{ReadText} 
& LR & $0.621 \pm 0.058$ & $0.620 \pm 0.217$ & $0.550 \pm 0.201$ & $0.542 \pm 0.099$ & $0.717 \pm 0.139$ \\
& SVM & $0.621 \pm 0.106$ & $0.367 \pm 0.342$ & $0.317 \pm 0.335$ & $0.333 \pm 0.333$ & $0.614 \pm 0.312$ \\
& RF & $0.629 \pm 0.178$ & $0.450 \pm 0.447$ & $0.333 \pm 0.408$ & $0.351 \pm 0.363$ & $0.590 \pm 0.302$ \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{Spontaneous}
& LR & $0.639 \pm 0.160$ & $0.469 \pm 0.292$ & $0.667 \pm 0.408$ & $0.539 \pm 0.321$ & $0.760 \pm 0.214$ \\
& SVM & $0.636 \pm 0.135$ & $0.600 \pm 0.435$ & $0.333 \pm 0.236$ & $0.400 \pm 0.253$ & $0.407 \pm 0.309$ \\
& RF & $0.721 \pm 0.176$ & $0.633 \pm 0.415$ & $0.600 \pm 0.435$ & $0.567 \pm 0.365$ & $\mathbf{0.828 \pm 0.148}$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 1 results by task (Dataset A, baseline features, unweighted)}
\label{tab:c1-summary}
\end{table}

\subsection{Dataset B: PD Speech Features Summary}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\small
\begin{tabular}{@{}lccccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Model} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{Precision} & \textbf{Recall} & \textbf{F1} & \textbf{ROC-AUC} \\
\midrule
LogisticRegression & $0.828 \pm 0.008$ & $0.881 \pm 0.010$ & $0.890 \pm 0.016$ & $0.885 \pm 0.006$ & $0.867 \pm 0.029$ \\
SVM\_RBF & $0.851 \pm 0.024$ & $0.841 \pm 0.015$ & $0.986 \pm 0.019$ & $0.908 \pm 0.015$ & $0.885 \pm 0.025$ \\
RandomForest & $0.882 \pm 0.019$ & $0.876 \pm 0.012$ & $0.980 \pm 0.015$ & $0.925 \pm 0.012$ & $\mathbf{0.940 \pm 0.013}$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 1 results (Dataset B, baseline features, unweighted)}
\label{tab:c1-datasetb}
\end{table}

\textbf{Note:} Dataset B shows substantially higher performance and lower variance than Dataset A, consistent with potential optimistic bias from unknown subject overlap.

\section{Condition 2: Extended Features (78) + Unweighted}
% Results generated by experimental pipeline (see Chapter~\ref{ch:experimental-design})

\subsection{Dataset A: MDVR-KCL Summary}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\small
\begin{tabular}{@{}llccccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & \textbf{Model} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{Precision} & \textbf{Recall} & \textbf{F1} & \textbf{ROC-AUC} \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{ReadText} 
& LR & $0.596 \pm 0.079$ & $0.600 \pm 0.253$ & $0.433 \pm 0.149$ & $0.475 \pm 0.106$ & $0.698 \pm 0.132$ \\
& SVM & $0.786 \pm 0.181$ & $0.733 \pm 0.435$ & $0.567 \pm 0.365$ & $0.634 \pm 0.386$ & $0.834 \pm 0.153$ \\
& RF & $0.818 \pm 0.140$ & $0.883 \pm 0.162$ & $0.700 \pm 0.298$ & $0.746 \pm 0.207$ & $\mathbf{0.822 \pm 0.166}$ \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{Spontaneous}
& LR & $0.671 \pm 0.199$ & $0.500 \pm 0.361$ & $0.600 \pm 0.435$ & $0.530 \pm 0.377$ & $0.783 \pm 0.139$ \\
& SVM & $0.636 \pm 0.089$ & $0.533 \pm 0.361$ & $0.400 \pm 0.279$ & $0.428 \pm 0.258$ & $0.460 \pm 0.294$ \\
& RF & $0.779 \pm 0.161$ & $0.683 \pm 0.410$ & $0.600 \pm 0.435$ & $0.605 \pm 0.387$ & $\mathbf{0.857 \pm 0.171}$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 2 results by task (Dataset A, extended features, unweighted)}
\label{tab:c2-summary}
\end{table}

\subsection{Improvement over Baseline (Random Forest, Dataset A)}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\begin{tabular}{@{}lccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & \textbf{$\Delta$ Accuracy} & \textbf{$\Delta$ ROC-AUC} & \textbf{$\Delta$ Variance} \\
\midrule
ReadText & +18.9pp & \textbf{+23.2pp} & Reduced (0.302 $\rightarrow$ 0.166) \\
SpontaneousDialogue & +5.8pp & +2.9pp & Increased (0.148 $\rightarrow$ 0.171) \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 2 improvement over Condition 1 (Random Forest)}
\label{tab:c2-improvement}
\end{table}

\textbf{Observation:} Feature extension dramatically improved ReadText performance (+23.2pp ROC-AUC) while SpontaneousDialogue showed modest gains (+2.9pp). This suggests extended features capture structured speech dynamics more effectively than spontaneous speech characteristics.

\section{Condition 3: Baseline Features (47) + Weighted}
% Results generated by experimental pipeline (see Chapter~\ref{ch:experimental-design})

\subsection{Dataset A: MDVR-KCL Summary}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\small
\begin{tabular}{@{}llccccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & \textbf{Model} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{Precision} & \textbf{Recall} & \textbf{F1} & \textbf{ROC-AUC} \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{ReadText} 
& LR & $0.596 \pm 0.079$ & $0.600 \pm 0.235$ & $0.550 \pm 0.201$ & $0.528 \pm 0.099$ & $0.717 \pm 0.139$ \\
& SVM & $0.704 \pm 0.111$ & $0.617 \pm 0.371$ & $0.500 \pm 0.373$ & $0.519 \pm 0.320$ & $0.542 \pm 0.312$ \\
& RF & $0.650 \pm 0.148$ & $0.550 \pm 0.371$ & $0.400 \pm 0.365$ & $0.431 \pm 0.306$ & $0.687 \pm 0.258$ \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{Spontaneous}
& LR & $0.639 \pm 0.160$ & $0.469 \pm 0.292$ & $0.667 \pm 0.408$ & $0.539 \pm 0.321$ & $0.760 \pm 0.214$ \\
& SVM & $0.693 \pm 0.123$ & $0.567 \pm 0.365$ & $0.600 \pm 0.365$ & $0.560 \pm 0.318$ & $0.423 \pm 0.312$ \\
& RF & $0.693 \pm 0.123$ & $0.583 \pm 0.373$ & $0.600 \pm 0.435$ & $0.538 \pm 0.326$ & $\mathbf{0.827 \pm 0.133}$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 3 results by task (Dataset A, baseline features, weighted)}
\label{tab:c3-summary}
\end{table}

\subsection{Effect of Weighting (vs Condition 1, Random Forest)}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\begin{tabular}{@{}lccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & \textbf{$\Delta$ Accuracy} & \textbf{$\Delta$ ROC-AUC} & \textbf{Effect} \\
\midrule
ReadText & +2.1pp & +9.7pp & Improved \\
SpontaneousDialogue & $-2.8$pp & $-0.1$pp & Negligible \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 3 effect of weighting vs Condition 1 (RF)}
\label{tab:c3-weighting}
\end{table}

\textbf{Observation:} Class weighting improved ReadText performance but had negligible effect on SpontaneousDialogue, suggesting task-dependent sensitivity to class imbalance handling.

\section{Condition 4: Extended Features (78) + Weighted}
% Results generated by experimental pipeline (see Chapter~\ref{ch:experimental-design})

\subsection{Dataset A: MDVR-KCL Summary}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\small
\begin{tabular}{@{}llccccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & \textbf{Model} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{Precision} & \textbf{Recall} & \textbf{F1} & \textbf{ROC-AUC} \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{ReadText} 
& LR & $0.650 \pm 0.108$ & $0.650 \pm 0.253$ & $0.550 \pm 0.201$ & $0.564 \pm 0.160$ & $0.698 \pm 0.132$ \\
& SVM & $0.761 \pm 0.214$ & $0.700 \pm 0.447$ & $0.567 \pm 0.365$ & $0.620 \pm 0.390$ & $0.834 \pm 0.153$ \\
& RF & $0.818 \pm 0.140$ & $0.883 \pm 0.162$ & $0.700 \pm 0.298$ & $0.746 \pm 0.207$ & $0.805 \pm 0.182$ \\
\midrule
\multirow{3}{*}{Spontaneous}
& LR & $0.696 \pm 0.179$ & $0.520 \pm 0.356$ & $0.667 \pm 0.471$ & $0.563 \pm 0.381$ & $0.783 \pm 0.139$ \\
& SVM & $0.664 \pm 0.167$ & $0.567 \pm 0.365$ & $0.600 \pm 0.365$ & $0.560 \pm 0.318$ & $0.403 \pm 0.347$ \\
& RF & $0.721 \pm 0.203$ & $0.653 \pm 0.409$ & $0.600 \pm 0.435$ & $0.583 \pm 0.373$ & $\mathbf{0.823 \pm 0.209}$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 4 results by task (Dataset A, extended features, weighted)}
\label{tab:c4-summary}
\end{table}

\subsection{Effect of Weighting (vs Condition 2, Random Forest)}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\begin{tabular}{@{}lccc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & \textbf{$\Delta$ Accuracy} & \textbf{$\Delta$ ROC-AUC} & \textbf{Effect} \\
\midrule
ReadText & 0.0pp & $-1.7$pp & Slight decrease \\
SpontaneousDialogue & $-5.8$pp & $-3.4$pp & Decreased \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Condition 4 effect of weighting vs Condition 2 (RF)}
\label{tab:c4-weighting}
\end{table}

\textbf{Observation:} Combining extended features with class weighting did not improve performance over extended features alone. This suggests that feature extension and class weighting address similar aspects of the classification problem, with diminishing returns when combined.

\section{Cross-Condition Comparison Matrix}

\subsection{Random Forest ROC-AUC by Task}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\begin{tabular}{@{}llcc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & & \textbf{Baseline (47)} & \textbf{Extended (78)} \\
\midrule
\multirow{2}{*}{ReadText}
& Unweighted & $0.590 \pm 0.302$ & $\mathbf{0.822 \pm 0.166}$ \\
& Weighted & $0.687 \pm 0.258$ & $0.805 \pm 0.182$ \\
\midrule
\multirow{2}{*}{Spontaneous}
& Unweighted & $0.828 \pm 0.148$ & $\mathbf{0.857 \pm 0.171}$ \\
& Weighted & $0.827 \pm 0.133$ & $0.823 \pm 0.209$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Random Forest ROC-AUC comparison matrix (Dataset A)}
\label{tab:rf-rocauc-matrix}
\end{table}

\subsection{Random Forest Accuracy by Task}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\begin{tabular}{@{}llcc@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Task} & & \textbf{Baseline (47)} & \textbf{Extended (78)} \\
\midrule
\multirow{2}{*}{ReadText}
& Unweighted & $62.9\% \pm 17.8\%$ & $\mathbf{81.8\% \pm 14.0\%}$ \\
& Weighted & $65.0\% \pm 14.8\%$ & $81.8\% \pm 14.0\%$ \\
\midrule
\multirow{2}{*}{Spontaneous}
& Unweighted & $72.1\% \pm 17.6\%$ & $\mathbf{77.9\% \pm 16.1\%}$ \\
& Weighted & $69.3\% \pm 12.3\%$ & $72.1\% \pm 20.3\%$ \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\caption{Random Forest Accuracy comparison matrix (Dataset A)}
\label{tab:rf-accuracy-matrix}
\end{table}

\subsection{Key Observations}

\begin{enumerate}
    \item \textbf{Feature extension consistently improves ReadText:} +23.2pp ROC-AUC (unweighted)
    \item \textbf{SpontaneousDialogue has higher baseline:} 0.828 vs 0.590 ROC-AUC with baseline features
    \item \textbf{Class weighting shows mixed effects:} Improves ReadText baseline but decreases extended feature performance
    \item \textbf{High variance throughout:} Standard deviations often exceed 0.15, reflecting small sample size (n=37)
\end{enumerate}

\section{Statistical Significance Notes}

Due to high standard deviations (often $>$ 0.15), confidence intervals overlap across many comparisons. This limits the ability to make strong statistical claims about differences between conditions. Results should be interpreted as \textbf{trends} rather than definitive rankings.
